column1: length outside off, hint of movement away, left alone by Watson
length outside off, plenty of swing back into Watson this time, as is his wont, he gets his front pad across and in the way but is struck quite high
length outside off, nice pace and carry, left alone
length outside off, bit of width on offer, cracked away off the backfoot by Watson, on the bounce to third-man's right, who does well to keep it to one
length on off, hint of movement back in, du Plessis punches it straight to point
length on middle, pushed back to the bowler
full outside off, driven to mid-off's left for one
full outside off, driven crisply down the ground, Williamson does well diving to his right and keeping it to one
length on middle, Watson stays back in his crease and pushes it to point with the away angle
full on the pads, that one swung back in a little, not what Khaleel is necessarily famous for, Watson misses the flick but gets a leg bye
length angled across, holds in the pitch a little, du Plessis checks his shot on the front foot and pushes it towards mid-off
length outside off, pushed to point
inducker, he went pretty wide to deliver that, Watson stuck in the crease gets a thick inside edge towards squareleg
length on middle, pushed back to the bowler

edged and over the only slip and into the boundary! It was full outside off, hint of room for Watson and he threw his bat at it, but what he did well was go really hard which helped him clear the slip fielder despite getting a genuine outside edge
length on the pads, clipped to mid-on's right for a couple
slower ball outside off, Watson has a slash but misses, Bairstow, who collected it quite low was briefly interested but none of his teammates were, probably for good reason
length angled across, extra bounce there for Khaleel as du Plessis throws his bat at it and misses
full on middle, du Plessis makes a bit of room and goes through the line and over the bowler's head
slower ball on middle, du Plessis tries to swat it down the ground like a tennis forehand but can't time it
slower ball, angled across, du Plessis wants to go over the off side but can't reach it
length outside off, hammered straight to cover
slower ball on middle, grips a little, du Plessis waits for it and then angles the bat to guide it to the keeper's right for one
slower ball on middle, pushed to mid-on
slower ball on the pads, helped along aerially and just wide of the diving short fine-leg to his left, and once it beat him, the result was never in question
slower ball on middle, pushed towards the covers with soft hands and they scamper one
goes for the yorker, doesn't get it right, it's in the slot for the drive and Watson finds the gap through the covers as it races to the fence
gets the yorker right this time, Watson makes room and squeezes it out towards cover for one
length on the pads, tucked away towards deep squareleg for a couple
length outside off, nice tight line, Watson looks to cut but doesn't have the room and is beaten
slower ball outside off, holds in the surface again, Watson goes hard at it but only manages to chop it away towards point for one
short on middle and du Plessis was camping on the backfoot waiting for the kind of length, and he pulls well in front of square and clears deep midwicket
length outside off, this time he makes a little room and blasts it through the covers
length outside off, the third-man is up so du Plessis goes for the reverse scoop and misses but so does Bairstow, conceding a couple of byes
length on middle, swatted down the ground but there's a long-on in place, who keeps it to one
length on the pads, tucked away towards squareleg
length on middle, pushed to long-on
full on middle, du Plessis skips down the wicket, makes a little room and goes through the line and clears long-off
quicker one, angled in, du Plessis pushes it to deep midwicket off the backfoot
short outside off, Watson rocks back and bisects point and short third-man with the cut
length on middle, pushed to long-off
short on middle, Watson down on one knee and hammers it away towards deep squareleg. It was something between a sweep and a pull but powerfully struck
full on middle, pushed back to the bowler
length on the pads, tucked away towards deep squareleg
another short one, a googly, Watson rocks back and pulls it to deep squareleg
length on the pads, pushed towards midwicket
full on the pads, swept fine but not fine enough to beat short fine-leg
full on middle, pushed to long-on for one
full toss on off, drilled to long-off
slower ball delivered from quite wide, du Plessis steers it to third-man
yorker length on middle, Watson shapes to go big but adjusts and pushes it to long-on
full toss on middle, slapped to long-on
full toss on the pads, Watson goes really low down and swats it away to long-on's right but the fielder makes good ground before putting in the slide to keep it to two
length on the pads, pushed to long-on
short, angled in, Watson goes low down for that half-sweep half-pull but doesn't time it
tossed up on middle, du Plessis skips down the track and takes on long-on, didn't seem to time it perfectly but the straight boundaries are shorter here and he clears the man
slows it down in pace, pulls his length back ever so slightly, Watson looks for the cut shot but is cramped for room and it crashes into middle
quicker one on the pads, clipped away for one
length ball on the pads, flicked away towards fine leg by Raina

and extra bounce does the trick. Short of length outside off, scrambled seam. Du Plessis looked to give himself some room by backing away, skipped down as well and went for the cut but not enough room, Bairstow pouches the outside edge
length outside off, looks to drive away from the body, gets an outside edge on to the pads, that dribbles towards fine leg
fuller on the stumps, comes forward and punches it towards mid-on
length outside off, goes for the cut but fails to keep it down, just away from the backward point, to his right
length around off, comes forward and offers a solid defence, was looking to steal a single as well but it went straight towards Nadeem at cover, retraces his steps in time
a googly from Rashid, stays back and taps it towards short midwicket
googly again, length just outside off and Raina pushes at it, gets beaten
beaten again! Another googly around off, Raina was looking to defend but it spins past the outside edge
legbreak this time, Raina stays back and cuts it late, past short third man for four, was hurried on to him though
another fast legbreak, goes back and pulls it towards midwicket, once again the ball hurries on to the batsman
short and on the leg stump, Rayudu pulls it towards fine leg, only a single
length around off, comes forward and defends it back towards the bowler who gets low in his followthrough but fumbles, the batsmen scamper for a single
length ball angling across the batsman, Raina was looking to swing it over midwicket, gets an outside edge the flies towards third man
a touch fuller around off this time, stays back and defends it towards mid-off with a straight bat
short of length around off, Raina rises on his toes and taps it towards square leg

just away from the short midwicket fielder, Rayudu uses his feet this time, to this length ball on the stumps, and ends up chipping it in the air, Williamson dives to his right but the ball evades him
another uppish chip, 128.9kph delivery on a length around off, Rayudu pushes at it, was in the air but well short of mid-off

an appeal for lbw and given. Raina has opted to review. A length ball on the stumps, pitching around leg and holding its line, Raina was looking to drag it on the leg side, misses and his struck right in front, would have gone onto the clip the top of middle and leg. Umpire's call on the stumps
length around off, comes forward and plays it towards covers with soft hands, steals a quick single to get off the mark
a googly, length outside off, Rayudu stays back and flicks it towards midwicket

another googly and Rashid has another lbw. Jadhav has reviewed it. Length ball outside off, Jadhav comes forward and looks to play around his pad, misses and his struck in front of the middle. Replays show it would have gone on to clip the top of leg. Once again umpire's call and that's the end of Jadhav
another wrong'un, length around off, comes forward and defends
length around off, comes forward and smothers it
short of length angled into the body, Rayudu defends it from the back foot
slower one, angling onto the pads this time, tucked away in front of square leg for a quick single
back of length outside off, comes forward and defends it on the off side, the backward point fielder is quick to the ball
a bouncer but too high, Billings was looking to pull but realises he cannot reach there and bails out

122.5 kph, slower ball does the trick, length outside off, Billings pushes at it with hard hands, cannot keep it down and ends up hitting it straight to Vijay Shankar at extra cover, near chest height. Shankar bends his knees and takes it with fingers pointing upwards
short of length outside off, some extra bounce there, left alone by Jadeja
length ball, angling into the batsman, tucked away towards the left of short midwicket
length ball but way down the leg side, Jadeja is happy with a wide
length ball, around middle and leg to cramp the batsman, Jadeja was looking to flick it away, misses, an appeal for lbw but not out, probably pitched just outside leg and seamed in a bit as well
length ball on the stumps, Jadeja stays back and punches it back towards the bowler
short of length on the stumps, Jadeja once again is back in his crease, punches it towards short midwicket
slower length ball outside off, Jadeja skipped down the ground, but is beaten by the lack of pace, had to adjust and defend it towards extra cover in the end
another knuckle ball, length outside off, Jadeja stays back and works it towards midwicket
short of length outside off, some room outside off, Rayudu goes back and cuts it past backward point to end the over with a boundary, still just six from it
length ball around middle and leg, Jadeja pushes it back towards the bowler
a googly, spins away sharply after landing on a length around off, extra bounce as well, Jadeja lets it go
length ball around middle and leg, pushed towards the bowler

flatter and quicker from Rashid, Jadeja comes forward and pushes it towards non-striker, Rashid slides across, picks it up and throws to Bairstow, Jadeja was looking for a single but gets back just in time
length ball on middle and leg, tucked away towards short fine leg

a beauty! Length ball around off, squaring Rayudu up as he looks to defend, was there an outside edge? Think he missed it, but Sunrisers have gone for the review. Replays confirm there was no bat involved, the ball brushed the back thigh on its way into Bairstow's gloves. But third umpire has to now check for lbw as well. It's umpire's call on the impact, just around off stump and umpire's call on the stumps as well, would have just clipped the off stick. So it stays not out
short of length in the rib cage, dabs it behind square on the leg side for one
short of length outside off, goes for the cut and finds the gap, a welcome boundary for CSK
a low full toss around off, thumps it towards long-off for one
another low full toss, Jadeja skips down and hits it hard towards mid-off, Hooda dives to his left but fumbles and concedes another one
short of length on the pads, looks to glance but misses, will collect a leg-bye though
fuller, in the blockhole outside off, digs it out towards covers
a floater outside off, fuller in length, hits it hard towards long-off, Jadeja is quick off the blocks and completes the second easily

a low full on the stumps, hits it towards deep midwicket and Jadeja is once again quick to come back for the second, the throw is at the bowler's end, Sandeep relays it to Bairstow but Rayudu is in by that time, Vijay Shankar chose the wrong end to throw
length ball, angling on to the pads, swiped towards deep backward square leg, only a single
Jadeja comes down the track, but seeing this Sandeep has slipped in a knuckle ball outside off, too wide though
a low full toss around off, Jadeja hits it towards deep midwicket but doesn't get the timing right, one bounce to the fielder
fuller outside off, goes for the reverse paddle but misses
fuller on the stumps, Rayudu comes down the track and looks to hit towards long-on, midwicket region, gets an inside edge on to the pads, only a single as the ball stops on the pitch
a low full toss on the stumps, goes down and swipes it towards short fine leg, Rayudu is struggling with the running here
a wide yorker, Jadeja digs it out towards long-off. Only a single though
fuller on the stumps, Rayudu skips down and hits it towards long-on, once again not timed well
a slower bouncer?! Short of length outside off, Jadeja was looking to cut it away but is confused by the lack of pace and ends up playing no shot
bouncer, once again a slower one, Jadeja goes for the pull but cannot connect
a low full toss around off, hits it towards wide long-on, Warner puts in a valiant slide from long-on and keeps it to two
length on middle, no swing, Warner turns it around towards squareleg to get off the mark
fuller on the pads and Bairstow capitalises first ball, clips it away beautifully to the deep squareleg fence
full on off, swing away for Chahar, induces the edge from Bairstow as he hangs his bat out, but gets a single to third-man
length  the pads, Warner picks it up aerially towards deep squareleg for two
fuller outside off, nice shape away, draws Warner forward and beats his outside edge
length on the pads again, inconsistent bowling here, Warner picks it up towards deep squareleg for another couple
full on off and Bairstow drills it down the ground and a lazy effort from the bowler means that it races to the fence once he is beaten
full on off, pushed to mid-off for a quick single
length outside off, too much width and Warner throws his hands at it, doesn't get all of it but enough to beat third-man to his left
length on off, much tighter from Thakur, Warner pushes it back to him
length on the pads, Warner tries to work it around towards squareleg but is struck on the thigh pad
length and down the leg side, it was an attempted slower ball gone wrong
length on the pads, tucked away to short fine-leg's right for a single
full and straight, pushed to mid-on for a quick single
slower ball on middle, holds in the surface, Bairstow checks his drive and chips it towards mid-on for one
slower ball on middle but overpitched and Warner controls his bat swing to adjust to the slowness of the delivery and just lofts it over the bowler's head for four
short and wide and four! Not quite a conventional cut shot but more a backfoot drive over cover and extremely well timed
length outside off, steered to third-man
length on the pads, another slower ball to Bairstow who is keen come at the bowler, tries to turn it around towards squareleg but can't connect and is struck on the thigh pad
overpitched and wide outside off, Warner drills it straight to mid-off, who is quite wide
length on middle, Warner has a hoick across the line, gets a thick inside edge to deep squareleg

slower ball but short and wide, Bairstow was a little early into the stroke but managed to clear the cover field and time it well enough to tease the fielder all the way to the boundary. three for Bairstow
short ball on middle, Warner ducks under it
full toss wide outside off, freebie from Thakur and Warner just times it through the covers, with no real flourish but it was four the moment it left the bat
short outside off, wayward bowling and Warner pounces on it again, slashes it away over extra cover for another four
length on the pads, clipped towards squareleg
length on the pads, Warner goes down on one knee and picks it up over short fine-leg for another four
length on middle, out comes the switch, picks it up over short third-man this time
overpitched outside off and caressed through the covers and Tahir's under the pump here
length on the pads, considerably slower, waits for it and pushes it towards midwicket for one
full outside off, Bairstow turns the face a little early looking to work it to the on side, gets a thick outside edge to short third-man
slower ball, angled in from around the wicket, Warner turns it around towards short fine-leg
another slower ball, the problem is that's too short and angled in, asking to be picked up towards deep squareleg and that's exactly what Warner does

fifty for Warner with the most unconvincing stroke of this innings! Quicker short one at the body, Warner can't quite free his arms to pull it over midwicket but gets it over mid-on like a tennis shot but manages to clear the man easily
full and in the slot but Warner's unable to clear mid-off as he ends up toe-ending it straight to the man. That's lucky for the bowler but he'll take it. Warner's done his job, however
length on the pads, Williamson gets going with a neat clip towards deep squareleg for a couple
full on off, comes forward and defends
full toss on middle, pushed to long-on
googly but short outside off, Williamson wait for it and pushes it to cover
slower outside off, legspinner this time, Williamson opens the face and steers it to short third-man
googly outside off, too short again, Bairstow punches it to deep cover for one

leading edge and taken by Tahir, who takes off immediately! It was a good length ball, held in the pitch, turned a little as well as Williamson looked to work it to the on side, was early into the stroke and ended up spooning a simple return catch to Tahir
full on off, pushed to long-off
full outside off, comes forward and pushes it with soft hands between cover and point
pulls his length back and nearly squares him up but he opens up adjusts and pushes it to point
full outside off, pushed to long-off
length outside off, punched to deep cover off the backfoot
quicker one on middle, uses the depth of the crease and turns it around towards squareleg
short and slow, doesn't come on at all as Bairstow looks to pull it away
full on middle, pushed back to the bowler
full on the pads, nearly chipped to midwicket
googly outside off, Bairstow comes forward, smothers the spin and pushes it to the leg side for one
googly outside off, pulled his length back there, Vijay Shankar watched it carefully onto his bat and defended it to point
short outside off, pushed to point
fired in on the pads, Bairstow goes across and down on one knee to scoop it past the keeper for a couple
length on middle, Bairstow comes down the wicket and hammers it over the bowler's head, bisecting long-off and long-on
length outside off, skids on a little, cut away to deep point and a direct him from the deep at the non striker's end allows two
length outside off, chopped away to point
fired in on middle, Bairstow pushes it back to the bowler
length ball on the pads, tucked away towards fine leg
length ball on middle and leg, Bairstow rocks back and pulls it over deep midwicket for a maximum
a similar line and length but a bit of extra bounce there, Bairstow looks to pull it for a six once again, misses and gets hit on the body
a slog sweep, taking it from outside off this time and smashing it over wide long-on for another six, only 35 needed now
plays back to this full delivery on the stumps, works it towards backward point with soft hands
length ball on the stumps, stays back and flicks it towards fine leg, 100 is up for Sunrisers
length ball around off, stays back and punches it towards short extra cover
length again, on middle and leg this time, punched towards long-on for a single
fuller around off, comes forward and pushes it past Jadeja for one more
length around off, some turn and bounce, played with gentle hands towards short third man
short of length outside off, goes back and cuts it towards deep cover
length around off, pushed towards extra cover off the front foot
a low full toss on the toes, flicked towards deep square leg
Tahir gets another one. Length outside off, Vijay comes forward and pushes at it, gets an outside edge and Billing does the rest. Tahir is off to his celebratory run
a googly first up, comes forward and pushes, the ball rolls towards short midwicket
length ball on the stumps, flatter and quicker, defended from the back foot
a googly, Hooda comes forward and flicks it towards short midwicket, a diving stop there prevents the single
short of length outside off, goes back to cut but doesn't get the timing right, chops it towards covers
length ball around off, punched towards sweeper cover off the back foot, hares back for the second
a touch fuller this time, once again outside off, driven towards deep extra cover this time
fuller on the stumps, driven towards long-off from the front foot
fuller outside off, drives it towards sweeper cover
length ball on the stumps, a bit slower through the air, driven towards extra cover
length ball on the stumps, comes forward, stays leg side of the ball and works it towards long-off
fuller on the stumps, comes forward and drives back, Karn stops it with a dive to his right
length ball on the pads, tucked away towards fine leg for a single
length ball on middle and leg, goes back and works it towards the left of short fine leg
length but way down the leg side, Hooda though stays leg side of the ball and chips it towards covers inside out
fuller on the pads, glanced straight towards short fine leg
fuller on the pads, flicked away towards square leg, the fielder is at the boundary and that allows Bairstow to come back for the second, and that's his fifty as well
short of length outside off, pulled towards midwicket for a single
too short and it just takes off after pitching, over Bairstow's head, a wide
just evades Watson at short midwicket. Short of length outside off, doesn't time the pull right, Watson moves to his left, stretches his hand out but the ball just touches the fingertips
short of length, steered towards third man for a single
fuller but way too outside off this time
length ball around off, stays in the crease and punches it towards long-on
length ball around off, Hooda uses his wrists to work it towards long-on
length outside off, a knuckle ball from Shardul, Bairstow waits for it before guiding it towards third man
length ball on the stumps, slog sweeps it towards deep midwicket
fuller on the stumps, driven inside out towards extra cover, Raina misfields and allows two runs
use of the feet by Hooda to go over extra cover, not the best of the timings but enough on it to take it towards the boundary
once again skips down but hasn't got it right, more height on distance this time and du Plessis takes an easy catch at long-off
and he finishes it with a six. Fuller around off, Bairstow comes forward and frees his arms to send it over long-on. And that ends SRH's three-match losing streak
